intro: Chorizanthe cuspidata var. villosa, commonly known as the hairy spiny gramaphytes, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and spiny, bract-like structures. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Its leaves are typically narrow, linear, and covered in fine, hairy pubescence, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
